intro: Mauloutchia annickiae, commonly known as the Annick's mauloutch, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pale pink to white. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It is noted for its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
